column4: that doesn't help , especially when theat same usb wifi stick works flwlessly on windows . like my belkin
it works on Windows is not the same as "it works in every OS ever designed by human hands"
this is why i replaced the mini PCI-E 802.11 card in my laptop with an Intel 4965
who set that rule ?
it's not a rule. it's a request.
very observant.
uhhh ...
feel free to discuss this with me in #ubuntu-ops if you feel my request was out of line
oh so you are an op ..what's the rule then , it would be good to clarify it here , f it's 30mins , then is a long time to wait for an answer.
such a discussion will needlessly clutter a support channel. like dr_willis and XDS2010 are currently doing.
no ...I've been in your ops chat before and it's not necessary , I'm just looking for a straight answer. What's the rule , or ist arbitrary /
it *is* necessary if you'd like me to answer.
then don't answer ...I don't see the need to be directed to the ops chat for a simple answer to a question that all ubuntu chat users should know about
ifconfig does not return route info
trolls?
yeahn rather than helping the subject first , you guys like to correct other ppls mistakes first
name-calling is hardly the answer.
I've been called worse :)
well, keep it to yourself in this channel, please.
same goes for you , if I make a mistake perhaps a friendly pm would be in order then I would correct my mistake in the channel myself
i will, one last time, invite you to discuss this in #ubuntu-ops.
you have *severely* tried my patience, and that of other ops. you are walking a tightrope, and i suggest you turn around and head back to the ledge.
nope,  no kangaroo court for me ... too bad about your lack of patience
